data.name: Nine Irish Ale
data.description: traditional style Irish Red made with pale, caramalt, chocolate, and a touch of Munich caramalt. This ale has a caramel sweetness that fades into toffee flavors. It’s balanced with East Kent Goldings and Fuggles hops to make a smooth sweetness and malt complexity. Fermented, with an Irish ale yeast, at lower temperatures to keep ester production down and give a tasty malt character.

style.name: Irish-Style Red Ale
style.description: Irish-style red ales range from light red-amber-copper to light brown in color. These ales have a medium hop bitterness and flavor. They often don't have hop aroma. Irish-style red ales have low to medium candy-like caramel malt sweetness and may have a balanced subtle degree of roast barley or roast malt character and complexity.  Irish-style Red Ales have a medium body. The style may have low levels of fruity-ester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl should be absent or at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: People's Brewing Company
breweries.description: The People's Brewing Company provides high quality hand-crafted beer and education of the craft beer industry to the people of Lafayette and the state of Indiana while providing community leadership with environmentally friendly business practices. We offer a taproom and tours of our facility. Our staff is fully trained on the brewing process, beer styles, and beer production. We encourage our customers to become educated in craft beers and local beer history.

breweries.name: Saugatuck Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Saugatuck Brewing Co. is a traditional Irish style pub that features 15 house-made drafts, hard cider and wines. All beer is produced on site in our 13,000 square foot Brew House. The full menu includes light snacks and unique entrees, along with home made desserts.  We offer 6 mainstay styles in bottles along with 3 seasonals and many specialties.

We feature the only brew-on-site facility in West Michigan. With five copper kettles, an array of natural ingredients, and over 100 recipes, we invite you and your friends to be the Brewmaster for a day. Create your own unique ale and return in two weeks to bottle 60 - 22 oz. bottles of fresh beer with a custom label of your choice.

The Singapore Room is our multi-purpose banquet facility. This includes a 4 tap bar, wine service and customizable menus. The Singapore Room can be rented out for a variety of events including birthdays, graduations, weddings, rehearsal dinners, etc.

data.name: Nitro Red
data.description: Inspired by the ales of Ireland, this red beauty is filled with rich caramel malts, a hint of roast, and just enough hop bitterness to balance. Enjoy the creamy mouth feel imparted by a classic nitrogen pour. Slainte!

data.name: Not The Irish
data.description: Our ale is a malty sweet and richly flavored red ale brewed with American malts and Goldings hops. On nitro for a smooth ride.

breweries.name: Verboten Brewing
breweries.description:
Verboten is an award-winning artisan craft brewery located in Loveland, Colorado. Our beers are an exciting mix between traditional styles and experimental brews, lovingly fretted over by our brewer, Josh Grenz. Verboten opened in 2013 and in 2014 took home two World Beer Cup medals. 

Carefully handcrafted from conception until our brew fills your glass, Verboten provides an endlessly exciting journey for craft beer lovers. Our tagline is "Beer for All," and we believe there is a perfect beer out there for everyone.

breweries.name: Widmer Brothers Brewing
breweries.description:
Widmer Brothers Brewing is located in beautiful and brew-friendly Portland, OR. Our publicly-held brewery employs over 150 people who are as passionate about quality craft beer as Kurt & Rob themselves.

We opened the brewery in 1984, and built a new 40-barrel brewing system in our current Russell Street location in 1990. We've grown steadily ever since. In 1996, we completed installation of a state-of-the art 250-barrel brewhouse, bringing our capacity to 220,000 barrels per year. In 1996, for the first time in our brewery’s history we also installed a bottling line, capable of producing 500 bottles per minute. In 2008 we added six new 1500-barrel fermentation tanks that increased our capacity to 450,000 barrels per year, and added a new keg filling line capable of filling 300 kegs per hour.

breweries.name: O'Fallon Brewery
breweries.description: At the O'Fallon Brewery we are passionate about making beer and we work hard to brew beers that look good, smell good and taste good! Ours is a small manufacturing brewery located in St. Charles County, just north and west of St. Louis, Missouri. Founded in January, 2000 by Fran and Tony Caradonna, the O'Fallon Brewery currently employs eight full-time. In 2009 we brewed around 4,100 barrels of beer...equivalent to about 57,000 cases.

data.name: O'Hara's Irish Red
data.description: “Brewed true to it’s heritage, the O’Hara family have gone back to basics and brew this fine Irish ale as it used to be brewed – with natural ingredients and no artificial additives”. Formerly known as Moling’s Red Ale and now carrying the family name of the brewery founders, this full-bodied Irish red, ruby in colour, is fruity and aromatic with a distinctive hop character balanced with a generous blend of sweet malts and has a distinctive roast finish.

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Carlow Brewing Company
breweries.description: Carlow Brewing Company is a small Irish Brewery established in 1998.  Carlow, a small town located in the Barrow Valley Region, the traditional malt and hop producing region in Ireland, once boasted a number of breweries, but the practice had been discontinued for over 100 years until revived in 1998 by Carlow Brewing Company.

breweries.name: Evil Czech Brewery
breweries.description:
Evil Czech has been operating since 2011 and opened it's doors to a new 20 barrel facility in 2014.

... sometimes for beer to be good, it has to get evil.

data.name: O'Phelan Irish Ale
data.description: You will feel the luck of the Irish after drinking this smooth, full-bodied, clean-tasting beer. It has a rich copper color with a sweet, inviting, and mild roasted malt flavor. This is a beer that will get you in the spirit to break out your dancing shoes and bust into a jig.

data.name: O'Regan's Revenge
data.description: Made from the finest floor malted Maris Otter and hopped with East Kent Goldings, O'Regan's Revenge drinks easy and is rich, balanced, dry, and satisfying.

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Sound Brewery
breweries.description:
Our tasting room is located inside the brewery complete with all the sounds, aromas, sights and sensations of a working production brewery. We have up to 11 of our beers on tap for $4/glass as well as non-alcoholic, small-batch Ginger Ale made right here in the brewery.

We have snack food such as smoked salmon and cheese from Crimson Cove Smokehouse, cookies from Mirracole Morsels and peanuts from CB's Nuts. If you have a big appetite, you are welcome to bring in food of your own or order something for delivery while you are here.

Children are welcome in our tasting room.

data.name: O'Shu
data.description: This beer is a bit of a good luck charm. ShuBrew was originally supposed to open in March of 2013, so we brewed up 3 bbl of this Irish Red to be available at our grand opening celebration. There was no intention for us to brew it on a consistent basis but people’s reactions to it were so good that we felt it was necessary to add as a staple to our lineup. This easy drinking beer has notes of caramel and honey with the smallest pinch of roasted malt to give it its signature red color.

breweries.name: ShuBrew
breweries.description: Nano brewpub located north of Pittsburgh in the historical town of Zelienople, PA.  We offer a wide selection of beers & full menu completely from scratch.  If the Shu Fits, Drink It.

breweries.name: Rockford Brewing Company
breweries.description: Three years ago a group of Rockford natives made the decision to share their passion for fine beer and food with others in the form of a brewpub. Our home is the historic Prairie Street Brewhouse, an important part of Rockford’s history and currently coming back to life as a mixed-use development. Home to the original Rockford Brewing Company, this building was one of the first breweries in the nation, pumping out over 75,000 barrels a year and its peak. Our shiny new 15-barrel brewery is the backdrop to Rockford’s newest destination for handcrafted beer and food. We are proud and excited to bring this wonderful piece of Rockford history back to life and look forward to exceeding expectations.

breweries.name: Magic Hat Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Saturnalian Saga of Magic Hat began in 1994 when our first batch of beer was brewed in a funky little space on Flynn Avenue, in Burlington, Vermont.  Dozens of beers and a brewery later, the Vermont brewery finds itself reaching more than 30 states with its unique take on classic styles.  Magic Hat continues to be a leader in craft beer and is currently the only craft brewer putting a performance in every bottle.

data.name: Off Kilter Scottish Ale
data.description:
This malty Scottish-style amber ale blends seven diverse grains, creating a smooth creamy texture and slightly sweet finish.

Like most Scottish ales, this brew is malt-focused because Scotland’s climate is unfriendly to hop cultivation.

breweries.name: Titletown Brewing
breweries.description: Titletown Brewing Co was founded in 1996 inside the historic Chicago Northwestern Train Depot in the heart of Green Bay, WI.  The brewpub is open year-round serving unique, hand-crafted dishes, fresh "honest" pints, and hand made Sno-Cap Root Beer.  Titletown's Beerworks production brewery was completed in 2014, bottling award winning beers just footsteps from the existing brewpub.

breweries.name: Pratt Street Ale House
breweries.description: Oliver Breweries was established in 1993, the brewing equipment being imported from the U.K., with the aim of creating authentic English Ales. Our hand crafted ales are brewed with imported malt and hops using a traditional single infusion mash technique and open fermentation with English Ringwood Ale Yeast.

data.name: Open Cab Copper
data.description: This Irish ale is a fantastic middle of the road beer with a balance of Malt and Hops to produce a slightly sweet beer that is refreshing and easy to drink. This copper/amber beer appeals to refined beer drinkers and also allows people trying Micros for the first time to experience a flavorful beer that will not offend any drinker. The Irish style from which this beer is derived is a favorite throughout the year being refreshing in the summer and a soothing staple through the fall, winter, and spring.

breweries.name: Quarry Brewing
breweries.description:
Quarry Brewing, L.L.C., located in historic uptown Butte, Montana, has brought handcrafted beer back to the mining city after a 40-year absence.

Chuck and Lyza Schnabel opened the Quarry on September 29, 2007. It has since garnered rave reviews from everyone who has tasted any one of the traditional-style ales produced on site.

Chuck, our Brewer, continues to brew rich, flavorful beers with only the finest ingredients available: choice hops, barley, yeast and filtered water. One taste will tell you: We Dig Beer!

data.name: Ould Sod
data.description:
Ever hear of an Irish Red India Pale Ale? Neither did we. Expect the unexpected with JP's Ould Sod, inspired by the age-old Red Ales of Ireland.

Decked out with a boatload of hops (Goldings, Fuggle & Hallertau) balanced with two-row and caramel malts. An adventure up for grabs on this road less traveled. Available in 6pack Cans and on tap. ABV: 6.0%

breweries.name: Great River Brewery
breweries.description:
Great River Brewery started in October of 2004 as a Brew Pub in Iowa City.  In December of 2008 we moved our entire brewing operation to Davenport, Iowa with hopes of starting our lifelong dream of packaging our beers.

In February 2009 we brewed our first batch of beer in our new Location.  Packaging started in May of 2010, with our 483 Pale Ale and Roller Dam Red Ale in 16 oz. cans.   Great River Brewery’s history is still being written each and every day.

data.name: O’hooley’s Irish Red
data.description: Brewed Every Spring for Jackie O’s St. Patrick’s Day party, O’hooley’s Irish Red is a high gravity take on an Irish beer style. The aroma is filled with delicious nutty caramel character. The bitterness is not overwhelming but helps balance out the abundance of caramel malts. The flavor is malt driven with some great spicy hop notes and soft fruitiness from our house yeast. Flaked Oats and White Wheat add a smooth mouth feel and a dense tight head. At 7.5%abv this Irish red will leave you feeling lucky.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: Jackie O's Pub and Brewery
breweries.description: Jackie O's Pub and Brewery prides itself in creating neo-traditional handcrafted artisan ales. Inside each pint, a fusion of American craft brewing creativity and historically sound techniques await your palate. A marriage of exploration and tradition guaranteed to cure whatever ales you!

data.name: O’reilly’s Irish Red
data.description: Amber-Red color with an off-white head.  Light, clean malty aroma with slight fruity esters.  No hop aroma.  Light-bodied mouth feel.  A malt focused beer with a dry, grainy character.  Not sweet, but surprisingly crisp & dry with just enough hop bitterness to balance the malt.  An easy drinking, low-alcohol session beer.

breweries.name: 10 Barrel Brewing Company
breweries.description: We started back in 2006 with three guys and one simple vision.. brew beer, drink beer and have fun doing it. Since then we have grown but our focus will always stay the same... Rough morning? Grab a beer. Powder day? The "gone skiing" sign goes up. Too hot to work? Mandatory company float. You get the picture... here's to living it up with a beer in hand!

data.name: Pacific Coast Brewing Emerald Ale
data.description: Emeral Ale is our most popular Seasonal Beer, named for the Emerald Isle and originally brewed for St. Patrick's Day. This Irish Red ale is full bodied with a rich malty profile.

breweries.name: Branchline Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Branchline Brewing Company is a production brewery based out of San Antonio, TX. We focus on high quality craft beer utilizing local and regional ingredients whenever possible. Branchline Brewing Company's focus is not only to provide our offering to the extreme craft beer drinker, but also to the casual drinker that enjoys a lighter product. 

Handcrafted ales for the independent at heart

data.name: Papakeechie's Reserve
data.description: A deep copper-red colored medium-bodied ale that harkens back to the spirit of Ireland. Our blend of specialty grains gives this beer its signature toasty and sweet aroma and flavor. A very drinkable crowd favorite. Have a wee bit of the Irish in your next pint.

breweries.name: Man Cave Brewing Company
breweries.description: Three friends turned a renovated pole building in Syracuse, Indiana, into a guys retreat. A perfect hangout to relieve the daily stress with no work, no worries, and of course no women!

data.name: PBW Irish Red
data.description: Made with toasted malts, smooth/even flavor with no bitterness and a sweet finish.

breweries.name: Paducah Beer Werks
breweries.description: Located at 301 N. 4th Street in the old Greyhound Bus station. Paducah Beer Werks is a brewpub offering 4 main beers with seasonal offerings, brick oven pizza, wings, and sandwiches.

data.name: Pelican Riptide Red Ale
data.description: Inspired by the traditional red ales of Ireland, Riptide Red has a beautiful dark copper color and a medium bodied presence. Our spring seasonal has a malt aroma reminiscent of toffee, caramel, and cocoa with a subtle floral bouquet. The lush aroma gives way to a full, rounded malty flavor with caramel notes, and a smooth well-balanced finish. Riptide Red is our local tribute to Irish heritage.

breweries.name: Pelican Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Welcome to the Pelican Pub Brew House. Darron Welch is the Brew Master here at the Pub. Before becoming the Brew Master, Darron was an assistant brewer for Adler Brau Brewery in Appleton, Wisconsin, but before that, he home brewed for many years in his hometown of Eugene, Oregon.

Darron was a key player in the creation of the Pelican Pub Brewery. He helped build the Pelican Pub from the ground up, designing the brewery layout and production flow as well as all of the fine Pelican beers.

data.name: Póg Mo Thón
data.description: Póg Mo Thón  is an Irish Red. This beer has a pleasant toasted malt character that is almost tea-like and a bit sweet in flavor.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Irish-Style Red Ale
style.description: Irish-style red ales range from light red-amber-copper to light brown in color. These ales have a medium hop bitterness and flavor. They often don't have hop aroma. Irish-style red ales have low to medium candy-like caramel malt sweetness and may have a balanced subtle degree of roast barley or roast malt character and complexity.  Irish-style Red Ales have a medium body. The style may have low levels of fruity-ester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl should be absent or at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.nameShortDisplay: Lexington Brewing Company and Wine House
breweries.description:
Think Globally, Drink Locally

Located in historic Lexington, MI the winery offers many award winning wines AND CRAFT BEER for samples, by the glass, and by the bottle. Wine makers Connie Currie and Steven Velloff have created a warm and inviting atmosphere  "Where the past meets the present and good friends come to meet."

Inside each pint, a fusion of American craft brewing creativity and historically sound techniques await your palate. A marriage of exploration and tradition guaranteed to cure whatever ales you!

data.name: Queen City Red
data.description: A deep mahogany red Ale blending six malts, in perfect harmony. Smooth and subtle yet robust and rich with flavors of coffee, malt, chocolate and toffee delicately balanced and enticing.

breweries.name: Four Friends Brewing
breweries.description:
We have conceived, created, and built, from the start; a meaningful brewery in the heart of Charlotte to celebrate your growing demand for hand crafted quality beer. With a focus on the revival of artisan brewing, we strive to create the highest quality products available.

Brewing techniques as timeless as beer itself are used to create a uniquely handmade product. We craft the finest possible beer in small batches normally not found in the industry today which is typically dominated by mega mergers of international breweries. Is this difficult and more time consuming? Yes. Does it require more manual labor? Yes. Is it worth it? Unequivocally, YES. As beer is a “living, breathing” product made from precise strains of active yeast cultures, it just makes good sense to nurture the product in very manageable small batches. We believe that the extra care and attention devoted to each batch produces the best possible result and you as our friends deserve no less.

We hope that you will have the opportunity to experience the limited quantities of hand crafted beer that we produce in Charlotte. When you do, please notice the complexities of the aroma, the silkiness of its body, and the explosion of flavors as the grains merge artfully with the yeast cultures and noble hops blended meticulously for each variety. Join us in celebrating the pleasures of hand crafted beers and life in the Queen City finally merged into this moment in time and allow yourself the pleasure of enjoying a uniquely Charlotte experience.

data.name: Radeau Red Ale
data.description: Cooper's Cave Ale Company's flagship ale is an Irish Red Ale. Three English Malts and one Belgian Munich Malt make up the grain bill. It is a full bodied Red Ale packed with flavor, blended with American Nugget hops for bitterness and East Kent Golding for flavor and aroma. This ale has turned the heads of many \dyed in the wool"American lager drinkers."""

breweries.name: Cooper's Cave Ale Company
breweries.description:
We'd been brewing up beer in the kitchen at home for a few years. In 1995, we were informed that Ed's corporate employer of eleven years was leaving the area (NAFTA). Not wanting to move, and having had enough of the corporate world, we decided to do some research and see what was out there. At that time there were no breweries, brew pubs or microbreweries in our area. A two week vacation to Nova Scotia was inspirational.

It was the comradery of the brewers, owners and staff members that really sold us on the idea of opening our own establishment.The Micro Brewery people we've met have been generous beyond our wildest expectations, with information, how-to, where to find it, etc.

data.name: Rado's Red
data.description: Upfront notes of toffee and caramel, slight hints of roasted grain and a bit of character dryness on the finish, Low hop bitterness contributed from English hop varietals.

breweries.name: Crow Hop Brewing Co
breweries.description: The main brewing philosophy of Crow Hop is to create well-balanced recipes that highlight each of beer's classic ingredients. Our seven core beers represent this philosophy, whereas our rotating selections give our brewers' creativity a chance to shine, in particular our Monthly Micro-fest. Each month, we release three to six pilot batches brewed around a common theme, from fruit beers to IPAs to a high gravity series - nothing is off limits. We strive to have products on hand that will excite and satisfy all kinds of beer lovers because for us at Crow Hop Brewing, it's about the beer.

breweries.name: Coronado Brewing Company
breweries.description:
When we opened the doors to our beach town brew pub on Coronado Island in
1996, we wanted it to be the kind of place where friends count enjoy great
beer, a good meal and a laid-back atmosphere.
Now, years later, our brewery’s a lot bigger and we’ve gotten a number of
awards. But we’re still following that same dream: brewing exceptionallly
balanced beer that’s authentically inspired by our West Coast roots. And
offering that experience to an ever-growing family that seeks an undeniable
coastal vibe, and shares our passion for great beer.
Welcome to Coronado Brewing Company. A Coastal Calling.

Welcome to Rapp Brewing Company!
Home of hand crafted small batch artisanal Ales and Lagers.
Our goal is to bring you the finest examples of traditional beer styles using the best available ingredients.
We also offer you intriguing variations of traditional styles as well as exploring styles from past ages.
We use our creativity in the art of brewing and invite you to join us in that adventure.

breweries.description: Founded by Aaron Burks in 1997, Atomic Ale Brewpub & Eatery is the Tri-Cities’ first brewpub. We feature a distinctive menu cooked in the Tri-Cities’ original wood-fired oven to complement our fresh, full-flavored handcrafted ales. Set in an atmosphere that reflects the rich history of the Mid-Columbia basin and the Hanford Site, we work hard to provide an exceptional dining experience.

breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

data.name: Rebellion
data.description: Brewed to a deep red and inspired by German brewing tradition, our Rebellion red lager is a crisp, refreshing and contemplative beer. The aroma holds light malt and caramel notes. While German Cara Red and Pilsner malts form the soul of this beer, it's capped with a light hoppy bitterness.

breweries.name: Yellowhammer Brewery
breweries.description:
Launched in late 2010 in downtown Huntsville, Yellowhammer Brewing seeks to bring Belgian and German tradition to Alabama. That means Euopean styles, but with a slight Southern interpretation.
Thanks to Free the Hops and the change in Alabama's formerly restrictive beer laws, creativity in brewing has come to Alabama.

At Yellowhammer, head brewer Keith Yager draws inspiration from both Belgian and German brewing traditions. An accomplished home brewer since 1995, Yager has designed numerous seasonal and specialty batches, from the Dark Hammer Belgian Quad to the UberAlt sticke ale. Other recurring ales are more experimental, blending styles, as with Tobacco Road, an imperial amber designed to complement a good cigar, or the occasional Lonesome Hop series, which spotlights the character of an individual hop. Yellowhammer is Yager's first commercial undertaking.

Yellowhammer Brewing opened on Oct. 16, 2010 with the best-selling Belgian white ale and the IPA. Other staples sold throughout the year include a German style altbier and the Miracle Worker, a potent Belgian tripel.

data.name: Red
data.description:
Our newest beer to fill our six-pack is Red—an Irish Style Ale.

Red is a traditionally styled Irish Ale with a hefty helping of malt, a little taste of roasted barley and some wonderful red color from the crystal malt, classically hopped with Fuggles and Kent Goldings.

You will really enjoy this winter warmer any time of the year.

breweries.name: Bear Creek Brews
breweries.description:
Bear Creek Brews has been a dream for over 30 years. Ever since the beginnings of the American Beer Renaissance, I have wanted to brew my own great tasting beer and make it available to the beer drinking public and help people learn about and appreciate beer. Coming from Oshkosh, Wisconsin, beer brewing is in my veins.

Twelve years ago my wonderful wife bought me the "everything but the kitchen sink" homebrew kit and it all started. After a few extract brew sessions, I built a 15 gallon brew sculpture and graduated to all-grain brewing, and things really got serious. Now after over 200 brews, BCB is in business!

The brewery is small, we call it a Nano-Brewery, we are hidden in the middle of 38 acres of woods in the heart of North Carolina. Most everything is recycled or made in-house. The Brew-House is an old 20' steel cargo container, the Beer-Garden brew patio is recycled flagstone and granite, nestled under spreading oaks and pines, our cooling water is stored rain water from a cistern, the chickens just love the spent mash. All the ingredients are as fresh as possible, some are even home grown. American malts, hops, and yeast are the mainstay of our beers. The water is from our 450' well and is just as pure and clean as can be. Our small batch brewing lets us assure you that each keg or bottle of beer will be as fresh and wonderful as though we were brewing it for ourselves to drink.

breweries.name: Farmington Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Farmington Brewing Company is the brainchild of two innovated scientists.   Jason Hendricks and Jason Schlaff met in the fall of  2009.  They didn’t know then that their friendship would bloom, but when it did, a brewery would be the flower.

The Jasons started humbly with a five gallon pot, a homebrew starter kit, and an idea of what good should be.  The first brew was just ok, an American Ale extract kit that did not allow for any artistry.  They quickly realized they needed to switch things up in order to attain the flavors they wanted.  So, the two amateurs ventured into the world of all-grain brewing.  The first mash tun, a cooler, the first brew, a porter.  Jason and Jason had their first failure.  

Poor taste and terrible color ruined their tongues but not their spirit.  They could do much much better.   Schlaff, an avid reader and researcher, dove head first into every book he could find.  Hendricks scoured the internet and talked to every expert he could find.  Armed with brains full of knowledge the two gents embarked on the brewing adventure again.  

The second beer, a blonde ale, crafted with the newfound comprehension they acquired.  After a two weeks of eager anticipation, success!  The Jasons now had the knowledge, the drive, and the skill.  Each ale after that was instant hit among their friends and family.  Gary Schlaff, Jason’s distinguished father, joined the endeavor in 2013.  Gary, a marketing genius, is nearing retirement and has decided to throw his business knowledge into the mix.

The brewery itself will not serve or prepare food.  Patrons will be allowed to bring in outside food, as well as have food delivered to them at the brewery.

We strive to be as sustainable and as local as possible.  The brewhouse and fermenters will be purchased for Psycho Brew LLC of Greenville, MI.  Our hops will be purchased from the many growers in Michigan.  Our spent grain will be sold to local farmers instead of going to waste in a landfill.  As a side project, we will also used the spent grain to made organic dog treats.

breweries.name: Jack's Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1999, Jack's Brewing Company opened its first full service microbrewery and restaurant at 39176 Argonaut Way, Fremont, California, on the west side of the Fremont Hub shopping center. Jack's is proud to announce the opening of our second location at 2410 San Ramon Valley Blvd., San Ramon, California in August 2009.

Jack's Brewing Company brews on premise every week to allow serving the finest and freshest quality beers in the area. We are known for fantastic California Pub Cuisine, ranging from incredible 1/2 pound gourmet burgers, Certified Angus steak platters, fresh salmon fillets sliced from fresh whole fish to delicious entrée salads and delightful desserts.

A sports themed restaurant with over 20 HD TV's and one 10-foot monster screen, Jack's offers the best sports viewing around at both locations. Our Fremont location offers a banquet facility available to suit corporate or large party needs; San Ramon can accommodate large parties within their dining room. Both locations are pleased to accept reservations for parties of six or greater.

Visit Jack's Brewing Company and enjoy Great Beer, Great Food, and Great Fun!

breweries.name: Nexus Brewery
breweries.description:
Nexus Brewery is dedicated on being the Albuquerque brewery that people can count on when it comes to providing amazing tasting beer and excellent food. We love good beer, and that makes our job just that much more fun. We sell delicious New Mexican soul food with a mix of southern comfort food. Come on down to Nexus Brewery and enjoy the beer we brew. We’d love to meet you and pour you a cold one.

You don't just drink a beer; you drink in the experience of life and all that goes with it.

Throw in the best beer in Albuquerque and it's an ExBeerience.

data.name: Red Ale
data.description: Red Ale (March – May) is brewed with British pale and crystal malts, Sterling hops, and an ale yeast from California. This ale has a rich ruby color, lacy collar, and a pronounced caramel flavor. Try it with traditional Irish fare or a sweet and pleasant cow’s milk cheese called Dubliner that can be found in most grocery stores.

breweries.name: Abita Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in 1986, the Abita Brewing Company is nestled in the piney woods 30 miles north of New Orleans.

In its first year, the brewery produced 1,500 barrels of beer. We had no idea what we started. Customers loved our beer! By 1994, we outgrew the original site (now our 100-seat brew pub) and moved up the road to a larger facility to keep up with demand.


We brew over 160,000 barrels of beer and 10,000 barrels of root beer in our state-of-the-art brewing facility. Our lagers and ales are brewed in small batches, hand-crafted by a team of dedicated workers with only the highest ideals of quality. This pride, along with our brewing process, is what creates our great brews.

We are privately owned and operated by local shareholders, many who have been with us since day one.

Abita uses only the finest ingredients – British and North American malted barley, German and American yeast strains, Pacific Northwest hops and the pure artesian water of Abita Springs.

In Abita Springs, we are blessed with the purest of water. Drawn from our deep wells, our pristine water is not altered in any way.

Abita Beer has no preservatives, additives or stabilizers and is cold filtered. The result is beer that is the finest and freshest tasting as proven by our loyal customers and great chefs of the south who use Abita Beer in their recipes.

data.name: Red Ale
data.description: This ale is made with a special roast of caramel malt, which gives it a lovely red hue and subtle caramel flavor. A large amount of hops is added late to the kettle and the fermentor, giving this beer a wonderful floral nose with hints of nectar and citrus carrying through to the palette.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Irish-Style Red Ale
style.description: Irish-style red ales range from light red-amber-copper to light brown in color. These ales have a medium hop bitterness and flavor. They often don't have hop aroma. Irish-style red ales have low to medium candy-like caramel malt sweetness and may have a balanced subtle degree of roast barley or roast malt character and complexity.  Irish-style Red Ales have a medium body. The style may have low levels of fruity-ester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl should be absent or at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Blue Frog Grog and Grill
breweries.description: Blue Frog is committed to producing traditional ales and lagers with a non-traditional twist. We use only the best ingredients to hand craft our balanced food friendly beers. Brewmaster Nick Campbell constantly tastes each batch to ensure its consistency and quality, leaning no beer released before its time. That’s commitment to quality.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon-Thu 11:30 am - 10 pm
Fri-Sat 11:30 am - 11 pm
Sun 11:30 am - 9 pm

data.name: Red Ale
data.description: A superior traditional red ale. Break through a balmy heavy cream head to a fruit filled characterful mouth, poised over caramel notes derived from deep roasted malts and not burnt sugar-like artificial additives.

available.name: Year Round

breweries.name: The Porterhouse Brewing Co.
breweries.description: First things first. We are passionate about beer. And not just our beer. We are passionate about all good beer. That's why in 1989 Liam LaHart and Oliver Hughes opened the first Porterhouse and specialised in importing various beers from around the world with a keen eye on Belgium.

breweries.name: Hops & Grain Brewery
breweries.description: Hops and Grain is a local Austin brewery that produces hand-crafted ales and handmade dog treats. We are very passionate about our craft and strive to create sustainability in everything that we do

Irish-style red ales have low to medium candy-like caramel malt sweetness and may have a balanced subtle degree of roast barley or roast malt character and complexity. breweries.name: Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.description:
Our brewers eat, drink and sleep beer. They’re equal parts scientist, artist and beer geek. So, while every Rock Bottom brewer is passionate about their craft, they also put their own signature into every beer.

In other words, there is a unique beer menu at every Rock Bottom in addition to our core line up of consistent flavor profiles that you can expect at any Rock Bottom you visit nationwide.

But, you’re thirsty and want to know what beers you can expect down here, right?

data.name: Red Ale
data.description: Modeled after a classic "mild" ale with low hopping and alcohol for easy drinking.

Irish-style red ales have low to medium candy-like caramel malt sweetness and may have a balanced subtle degree of roast barley or roast malt character and complexity.  Irish-style Red Ales have a medium body. The style may have low levels of fruity-ester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl should be absent or at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. breweries.name: Anacortes Brewery
breweries.description: Our brewers focus on high quality ingredients, a carefully controlled process and delicate handling to provide one of the best beers you will find in the industry. We operate a seven barrel brewery designed and installed by Sound Brewing Systems of Seattle with vessels fabricated by Ripley Stainless in British Columbia. Our brewery features a cold room specially designed for lagering to provide our beers with a traditional character and complexity.
